intro: Mesembryanthemum variabile, commonly known as the variable ice plant, is a flowering plant native to southern Africa. It belongs to the Aizoaceae family, known for its succulent foliage and vibrant flowers. The plant is characterized by its fleshy, often hairy leaves and clusters of small, star-shaped flowers that bloom in shades of yellow, orange, and red. It thrives in arid and semi-arid environments, adapting well to hot, dry conditions. Mesembryanthemum variabile is often used in rock gardens and xeriscaping due to its drought tolerance and ornamental value.
